title: What’s the population of Gilead? And what happened to black and gay people?
self_text: I feel like, in a strange way, the lore of the handmaids tale almost feels like it is unconscious, real history. title: New PC Build Ideas Needed - Budget Around $1200
self_text: Hey everyone! I'm finally building a new PC and I'm feeling a little overwhelmed with all the choices. I'm aiming for a budget around $1200-$1400 USD. I'm primarily a gamer (PC mostly, but occasionally console), and I also do some video editing. I'd like it to handle modern AAA titles at 1440p resolution with good frame rates (60+ FPS).  I'm relatively new to PC building, so I'd appreciate recommendations for a balanced build – CPU, GPU, motherboard, RAM, storage, and PSU.  Specifically, I'm leaning towards an Intel Core i5 or AMD Ryzen 5 processor, and I’m flexible on the GPU depending on value. I’m located in the United States.  Any suggested component lists or links to helpful resources would be hugely appreciated! Thanks in advance!

title: Can I accept halal food from my secular nephew's father?
self_text: Asallam alaikom everyone,  I'm a revert living with my family, including sister, her boyfriend and their son, my nephew. I only speak what is necessary to my nephew's father and never greet him with hello or good morning. I never stay in same room with him alone but when I buy food for the house, it for everyone so he feels he wants to do the same. Can I accept halal food from him? Can I borrow some of his protein powder because I've been training really hard and muscles sore and need some food !  Or would that make me a hypocrite?  Jazak'Allah kheiran for reading from me

title: Why is it important to get vaccinated?
self_text: I know there are a lot of different opinions on vaccinations, but I truly believe they are incredibly important for protecting ourselves and our communities. Vaccines help strengthen our immune system and provide protection against serious illnesses that can be devastating. Getting vaccinated not only protects you personally, but it also helps reduce the spread of diseases and safeguards vulnerable populations, like infants and those with weakened immune systems. Talk to your doctor to get the recommended vaccines and stay healthy!

title: Why do I feel disconnected from my faith?
self_text: I've been a lifelong member of a mainline Protestant denomination, and lately, I’ve been feeling increasingly detached from my faith. I attend services regularly, participate in activities, and intellectually understand the tenets of our tradition, but I don't *feel* it anymore. It’s like observing a beautiful ceremony without truly participating. I'm wrestling with questions about purpose, meaning, and whether my understanding aligns with a genuine experience of faith. I'm not questioning my beliefs themselves, but rather the emotional connection. Has anyone else experienced this, and if so, how did they navigate it?

title: Why do I feel disconnected from my faith?
self_text: I've been regularly attending services and praying, but lately, I’ve been feeling increasingly detached. It's not a dramatic crisis, more of a persistent dullness. I find myself going through the motions, but lacking genuine emotional engagement. I’ve tried journaling, reflecting on scripture, and seeking guidance from trusted mentors, but the feeling remains. I’m questioning whether my understanding of faith is superficial, or if something deeper is missing. Has anyone else experienced this, and if so, how did you navigate it?

*   **CPU:** AMD Ryzen 5 7600X

title: How to Train Your Dragon is Animated Valyria

title: Help with Astral Projection attempts are meditations to work and cultivate vital energy as well
self_text: I feel that I work best my energy body when I'm attempting an Astral Projection. Even when I don’t fully exit my physical body, I seem to be more readily available to work on my chakras and kundalini.  Here I'm sharing four reports from my notes. If anyone would like to hear me talk about it,https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N5SJ_hhHq2s  In the 1st report, I talk about the intensity of the vibrations and sound, how distracting it can be and how I tried to maintain focus and courage by convincing myself that it's OK to experience this "little death".  In the 2nd report, I talk about the obstacles of the mental constructs in the Astral Plane and the idea of the "cocoon".  In the 3rd report, I talk about false awakening and the notion of percentages of perception.  In the 4th report, I mention Kundalini energy and talk about strange and unique sensations after waking up physically. This last report is very reminiscent of an entheogenic experience, because of light patterns, physical body load, headspace and feelings of Oneness once physically awake.

title: Why is the White Walker's ice affecting the environment?
self_text: During Game of Thrones, we consistently see the White Walkers’ presence causing widespread freezing and impacting plant life. It's a fascinating and terrifying element of the show's worldbuilding. I’ve been pondering the scientific plausibility (within the fantastical realm, of course) of this phenomenon. What theories or explanations have you considered regarding *why* their icy touch has such a dramatic environmental impact? Is it purely magical, or is there a more tangible, albeit extraordinary, cause at play?

title: What's the population of Gilead? And what happened to black and gay people?
self_text: I feel like, in a strange way, the lore of the handmaids tale almost feels like it is unconscious, real history.   Not in a literal way, but like it calls to something primal and buried deep within the human heart.   Which is odd, since it is entirely fictional and dragons don’t exist.  From the beginning I’ve been wondering about the population of Gilead, and what happened to black and gay people. I know that when the takeover started, many people fled continental US, and many people were killed. What of those left, what’s the population?   Also, what happened to gay people and black people? Like I feel like you only see black handmaids, some of who are also lesbians and fertile but aren’t allowed to act on it (obviously). I think we see a photo of a gay male couple in season 5, who are presumed dead, so was that the fate of all gay men?

title: How to Create a Simple Home Automation System with Raspberry Pi

Hey everyone! I’m looking to dip my toes into the world of home automation and was hoping to get some guidance. I’m relatively new to electronics and programming. I want to create a basic system to control a few lights and maybe a smart plug. I’m thinking of using a Raspberry Pi as the central hub.

I’ve been researching Home Assistant, which seems popular and relatively beginner-friendly. I’m also curious about Zigbee and Z-Wave protocols – which one would you recommend for a small project like this? I'm also a little confused on what hardware I’ll need for this. What are some good starter kits or specific components (sensors, relays, etc.) that would be suitable for a beginner?

Any recommendations for tutorials or resources would be hugely appreciated! Thanks in advance for your help!

title: Why does the sky appear blue?
self_text: The scattering of sunlight by air molecules is known as Rayleigh scattering. Blue light has shorter wavelengths than red light, and is therefore scattered more effectively in all directions. This is why we perceive the sky as blue during the day.

title: Why does the color blue represent sadness?
self_text: I’ve been noticing a recurring association between the color blue and feelings of sadness or melancholy in literature, film, and art. It’s not always explicitly stated, but blue frequently evokes a sense of longing, loneliness, or grief. I'm curious to know if this is a widespread cultural phenomenon, and if there are historical or psychological explanations for why blue is so often linked to sadness. Does anyone have insights into the origins of this association?

title: Why is the Tower of Babel story so fascinating?
self_text: I've been reading about the Tower of Babel myth and it keeps sticking with me. Beyond the straightforward story of hubris and divine intervention, I'm intrigued by the *idea* of a unified humanity speaking a single language. It raises questions about the origins of diversity, the nature of communication, and perhaps even the potential dangers of unchecked ambition. What aspects of the myth resonate with you the most, and why do you think it continues to be retold and interpreted across cultures?

title: What's the population of Gilead? And what happened to black and gay people?
self_text: I feel like, in a strange way, the lore of the handmaids tale almost feels like it is unconscious, real history. Not in a literal way, but like it calls to something primal and buried deep within the human heart. Which is odd, since it is entirely fictional and dragons don’t exist.  Many people say that the Handmaid’s Tale is a cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism, misogyny, and religious extremism. Others argue that it’s a commentary on American culture and social dynamics.  Some claim the story mirrors historical events, drawing parallels to the Salem Witch Trials, the Spanish Inquisition, and even Nazi Germany. Considering the lack of diversity portrayed in Gilead, what do you think about the portrayal of black and gay people? Were they systematically eliminated, or do you think they managed to survive and potentially influence the resistance movement? I know that when the takeover started, many people fled continental US, and many people were killed. What of those left, what’s the population?  It’s just fascinating to think about how the story resonates with so many different interpretations and anxieties.

title: Sleep paralysis
self_text: I’ve been having increasingly frequent episodes of sleep paralysis. It starts with a feeling of falling, and then I wake up unable to move or scream, with a shadowy figure standing over me. It’s terrifying. I've researched it and read that it’s often linked to stress and anxiety, but it’s still incredibly distressing. Has anyone else experienced this, and if so, do you have any tips for coping with it?

title: Why do I feel so disconnected from my faith?
self_text: I’ve been consistently attending church and praying regularly for several years, but I’m increasingly feeling detached and questioning my beliefs. It’s not that I actively *reject* faith, but I don’t experience the same sense of connection or joy that I used to. I find myself struggling to engage with scripture and participate in services. I’m concerned about losing my faith altogether, but also hesitant to pursue traditional avenues for seeking guidance, fearing they might reinforce this feeling of disconnection. Has anyone else experienced something similar, and if so, how did you navigate it?

title: Why does the ending of *The Handmaid’s Tale* feel so bleak?
self_text: I just finished watching Season 5, and I'm struggling with the ending. While it was powerful and showed June's defiance, it also felt incredibly desolate and offered very little hope.  It’s not just about June escaping; it’s about the overwhelming, suffocating reality of Gilead and the seemingly insurmountable odds against resistance.  I understand the show aims to be realistic and unflinching, but I’m left feeling emotionally drained and unsure of what the point of any of it was.  Did others feel this way, or was I just overly invested in finding a brighter outcome?

title: How to Train Your Dragon is Animated Valyria
self_text: I feel like, in a strange way, the lore almost feels like it is unconscious, real history.   Not in a literal way, but like it calls to something primal and buried deep within the human heart.   Which is odd, since it is entirely fictional and dragons don’t exist.  Does anyone else get what I mean, though?

title: New PC build help - Budget around $1200
self_text:
Hey everyone, I'm building my first gaming PC and aiming for a budget around $1200 USD. I'm primarily interested in 1080p gaming at 60fps+, ideally 1440p with some tweaking. I'm relatively new to PC building so I appreciate detailed recommendations.  Currently considering:

*   **CPU:** AMD Ryzen 5 7600X (~$230)
*   **Motherboard:** MSI B650 Tomahawk WIFI (~$200)
*   **RAM:** 32GB DDR5 5600MHz CL36 (~$100)
*   **GPU:** NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4060 Ti 8GB (~$400)
*   **Storage:** 1TB NVMe SSD (~$70)
*   **PSU:** Corsair RM750x (750W) 80+ Gold (~$130)
*   **Case:** Fractal Design Meshify 2 Compact (~$120)

I'm open to suggestions and alternatives.  Specifically, I'd love feedback on whether this build is balanced and if there are any significant upgrades I should consider for the price range.  Any links to reputable retailers would be helpful too!

Thanks in advance!

title: How to Train Your Dragon is Animated Valyria
self_text: Rewatching How to Train Your Dragon, and as a fun thought it's basically the PG animated version of House of the Dragon specifically around Valyria.  Separated into the two syllables "Shire" and "Reen" the name can be read as "Bright-Reborn" using Old English (which George very commonly uses) and French.  >Shere or Shire is derived from the Old English "scir", meaning  "fair, bright, shining" .  >René meaning  born again or reborn  in French is derived from the Latin name Renatus.  Why think French? Because the name Shireen or "Shereen" is also a French name from the word "chéri"  (Listen to Google translate French to English say chéri. The pronunciation is almost exactly the same) .  Additionally, it's also a name from the old French kingdom of Béarn.   This reading of the name very closely matches the language used when a follower of R'llor discusses fire sacrifice or death.  >"Let these girls be reborn in light. - Victarion  >Better that they be reborn into the light." - Selyse   The name "Shireen" is a play on words.  Within the "darling" Shireen or "chérie"  hides a more sinister meaning related to R'llor worship.

title: The importance of remembering your roots
self_text: As a devout christian, I find it incredibly important to remember where I came from.  Growing up in a rural area with a strong faith community instilled in me a deep appreciation for simplicity, humility, and the unwavering guidance of God.  While the world constantly pushes us toward materialism and superficiality, I find strength and purpose in returning to these foundational principles.  It’s a reminder that true happiness isn’t found in possessions or fleeting pleasures, but in cultivating a genuine relationship with the Divine and living a life guided by compassion and grace.  Connecting with my roots helps me remain grounded and focused on what truly matters – serving God and loving my neighbors.

title: I’m having trouble understanding the concept of “inner alignment” in meditation
self_text: I've been trying to incorporate meditation into my daily routine for a few weeks now, primarily using guided meditations focusing on mindfulness and breathwork. Lately, I’ve been encountering the phrase “inner alignment” frequently in various resources and discussions about meditation. I’m finding it difficult to grasp what it truly entails and how to actively cultivate it. Could someone provide a clearer explanation of what “inner alignment” refers to in the context of meditation, and perhaps suggest practical techniques or exercises for developing this state?

It feels like I endlessly weigh pros and cons, analyze potential outcomes, and generally get paralyzed by indecision. Sometimes it’s just picking what to eat for dinner, other times it's bigger choices about work or relationships. It’s exhausting. Has anyone else experienced this? Do you have any strategies for overcoming this paralysis?

title: How to Get Started With Home Automation
self_text:
Hi all! I’m looking to dip my toes into home automation and want some advice. I currently have a Philips Hue starter kit, and I’m hoping to expand from there. I'd like to eventually integrate everything into a central hub. I'm leaning towards Home Assistant as my primary platform, but I’m not sure about the best way to approach it. *   What’s the easiest way to connect my existing Hue bulbs to Home Assistant?
*   Should I invest in a dedicated Zigbee gateway (like a Sonoff Zigbee Bridge) or can I rely on the built-in Zigbee capabilities of my Raspberry Pi?
*   Are there any recommendations for affordable smart switches and sensors that work well with Home Assistant?

Thanks for any guidance!

title: Why do some people find Gregorian chants unsettling?
self_text: I’ve been noticing a recurring theme in discussions about Gregorian chant – some people describe it as deeply unsettling, even frightening. It's not a universal reaction, of course, but a significant portion of listeners report a visceral unease. I’m curious about the potential psychological and perhaps even neurological reasons behind this response. Theories range from the inherent dissonance of the harmonies to associations with religious rituals and historical contexts. Does anyone have insights into why this particular style of music evokes such a strong, often negative, emotional reaction in some individuals?

title: Sleep paralysis

It’s not just a fleeting sensation anymore; it’s lasting longer, and the accompanying hallucinations are more vivid and terrifying. I’ve researched potential causes – stress, sleep deprivation, anxiety – and tried some relaxation techniques, but nothing seems to consistently work. Has anyone else dealt with persistent sleep paralysis, and if so, what coping mechanisms or treatments have been helpful? I'm starting to feel like I’m trapped in a recurring nightmare.

title: Lost my favorite pen

I’ve searched everywhere, emptied drawers, checked under furniture, and I just…can’t find it. It was a gift from my grandfather, and it’s irreplaceable. title: Why is the concept of "spiritual bypassing" controversial?
self_text: Spiritual bypassing is a term coined by John Welwood that describes using spiritual concepts and practices to avoid dealing with painful emotions, unresolved trauma, and psychological difficulties. While proponents argue it can be a helpful tool for temporarily alleviating distress, critics contend it can hinder genuine emotional processing and create avoidance behaviors. Many believe it risks masking underlying issues rather than addressing them constructively. Others worry it can be used to justify neglecting personal responsibility and authentic self-expression. What are your thoughts on this concept? Do you think it's ultimately beneficial or harmful?

title: Lost my favorite mouse
self_text: Hey everyone, I’m incredibly frustrated. I’ve been using a Logitech MX Master 3 mouse for years and it was *perfect* for my workflow. Yesterday, I was working from home, and I distinctly remember placing it on my desk. When I went to use it five minutes later, it was gone. I’ve searched everywhere – under the desk, behind furniture, in drawers – nothing. It’s vanished. I’m not sure if it rolled somewhere, or if someone took it. It’s driving me crazy! Does anyone have any tips for finding a lost mouse? Any tricks I can try? Seriously appreciate any advice.
